snippet: In a chamber where her party is in the minority, Representative Nancy Pelosi is charged with rounding up votes for a strike on Syria, a measure opposed by most Americans.
abstract: House Democratic leader Rep Nancy Pelosi is charged with rounding up enough votes from her caucus to win approval of a use-of-force measure against Syria requested by Pres Obama; task is a sharp test of loyalty for Pelosi, as many Democratic members are privately seething over fact that they are being asked to vote for measure that most of the country does not support.
lead_paragraph: In a chamber where her party is in the minority, Representative Nancy Pelosi is charged with rounding up votes for a strike on Syria, a measure opposed by most Americans.

headline.main: Sharp Test Among Democrats of Loyalty to Obama
headline.print_headline: Sharp Test Among Democrats of Loyalty to a Leader
